00026 #ifdef __mac_compatiblity__
00027 #define MAGNIFICATION       2.0
00028 #else
00029 #define MAGNIFICATION       1.5
00030 #endif

00032 
00033 /* possible actions */
00034 
00035 #define SETUP   0 
00036 #define INIT    1
00037 #define RUN     2
00038 #define PAUSE   3
00039 
00040 #define N_LINKS 3
00041 
00042 int action = SETUP;
00043 
00044 double l[N_LINKS+1] = {0.,1.,1.,.4};
00045 double th[N_LINKS+1] = {0., -PI/4., 1./4.*PI, 1./4. * PI};
00046 
00047 double x0,y0;  /* the cartesian coordinates to be kept */
00048 double th0[N_LINKS+1] = {0., -PI/2., PI/2., PI};

00063 /*!*****************************************************************************
00064  *******************************************************************************
00065 \note  doUserpgm
00066 \date  10/20/91
00067 
00068 \remarks 
00069 
00070       Main program for cooperation with the frame.c program. Distributes
00071       the different tasks according to >>action<< to other functions.
00072 
00073  *******************************************************************************
00074  Function Parameters: [in]=input,[out]=output
00075 
00076       none
00077 
00078  ******************************************************************************/
00079 void
00080 doUserpgm()
00081 {
00082 
00083   int                 i, m, count, rc;
00084   char                string[100];
00085   double              tol = 0.000001;
00086 
00087 
00088 
00089   switch (action) {
00090 
00091 
00092   case SETUP:
00093 
00094           initialize();
00095           create_windows();
00096           
00097     action = INIT;
00098 
00099     break;
00100 
00101 
00102   case INIT:
00103   
00104 
00105     action = RUN;
00106     
00107     draw_arm();
00108     
00109     break;
00110 
00111 
00112   case RUN:
00113   
00114         getchar();
00115   
00116         parm_opt(th,3, 2, tol, f_dLda, f_dMda, f_M, f_L);
00117   
00118     draw_arm();
00119     
00120     action = PAUSE;
00121     
00122     break;
00123 
00124 
00125   case PAUSE:
00126         
00127                 draw_arm();
00128 
00129     break;
00130 
00131 
00132   default:
00133 
00134     printf("Unknown action! Hit return to exit ...\n");
00135     getchar();
00136     exit(-1);
00137 
00138   }
00139 
00140 
00141 }

00144 /*!*****************************************************************************
00145  *******************************************************************************
00146 \note  create_windows
00147 \date  10/20/91
00148 
00149 \remarks 
00150 
00151       create necessary windows for this programs
00152 
00153  *******************************************************************************
00154  Function Parameters: [in]=input,[out]=output
00155 
00156       none
00157 
00158  ******************************************************************************/
00159 void
00160 create_windows(void)
00161 {
00162 
00163   myWindowData        windata;
00164   int                 i, m;
00165   int                 num=0;
00166   char                name[100];
00167 
00168 
00169   windata.ident = 1;
00170   windata.rect.top = 40 * MAGNIFICATION;
00171   windata.rect.left = 1 * MAGNIFICATION;
00172   windata.rect.bottom = 240 * MAGNIFICATION;
00173   windata.rect.right = 121 * MAGNIFICATION;
00174   sprintf((char *) windata.title, "Robot Arm\0");
00175   windata.visible = TRUE;
00176   windata.type = documentProc;
00177   windata.goaway = TRUE;
00178   windata.goawayhide = TRUE;
00179   windata.grow = TRUE;
00180   windata.windowkind = AnimateWin;
00181   windata.muchdata = TRUE;
00182   windata.fronttimeout = 1;
00183   windata.backtimeout = 1;
00184   windata.resolution_x = 10000.;
00185   windata.resolution_y = 10000.;
00186   windata.myworld.top = 2.;
00187   windata.myworld.left = 0.0;
00188   windata.myworld.bottom = -2.0;
00189   windata.myworld.right = 2.;
00190   windata.margin_x = .01 * (windata.myworld.right - windata.myworld.left);
00191   windata.margin_y = .01 * (windata.myworld.top - windata.myworld.bottom);
00192   windata.draw_axes = TRUE;
00193   windata.draw_frame = TRUE;
00194 
00195   gen_window(windata);
00196 
00197 
00198 }

00200 /*!*****************************************************************************
00201  *******************************************************************************
00202 \note  draw_arm
00203 \date  10/20/91
00204 
00205 \remarks 
00206 
00207       draws all oscillators 
00208 
00209  *******************************************************************************
00210  Function Parameters: [in]=input,[out]=output
00211 
00212       none
00213 
00214  ******************************************************************************/
00215 void
00216 draw_arm(void)
00217 {
00218         
00219         
00220         if (StartOutput(1)){
00221         
00222                 MoveTo(Sx(0.0),Sy(0.0));
00223                 LineTo(Sx(l[1]*cos(th[1])),Sy(l[1]*sin(th[1])));
00224                 LineTo(Sx(l[1]*cos(th[1])-l[2]*cos(th[1]+th[2])),
00225                         Sy(l[1]*sin(th[1])+l[2]*sin(th[1]+th[2])));
00226                 LineTo(Sx(l[1]*cos(th[1])-l[2]*cos(th[1]+th[2])+l[3]*cos(th[1]+th[2]+th[3])),
00227                         Sy(l[1]*sin(th[1])+l[2]*sin(th[1]+th[2])+l[3]*sin(th[1]+th[2]+th[3])));
00228                 
00229                 StopOutput(1);
00230                 
00231         }
00232                 
00233 }

00250 void 
00251 initialize(void)
00252 
00253 {
00254 
00255         int             i,j,m,n;
00256         double          vec[3];
00257         
00258         f_M(th,vec);
00259         
00260         x0 = vec[1];
00261         y0 = vec[2];
00262                 
00263 }

00265 /*!*****************************************************************************
00266  *******************************************************************************
00267 \note  f_L
00268 \date  10/20/91
00269 
00270 \remarks 
00271 
00272       calculates the simple costs (without constraints)
00273 
00274  *******************************************************************************
00275  Function Parameters: [in]=input,[out]=output
00276 
00277  \param[in]     a: vector of parameters
00278       returns the cost;
00279 
00280  ******************************************************************************/
00281 double 
00282 f_L(double *a)
00283 
00284 {
00285 
00286         int    i;
00287         double cost=0.;
00288         
00289         for (i=1; i<=N_LINKS; ++i) {
00290                 cost += 0.5*sqr(th[i]-th0[i]);
00291         }
00292         
00293         return cost;
00294 
00295 }
00296 
00297 /*!*****************************************************************************
00298  *******************************************************************************
00299 \note  f_dLda
00300 \date  10/20/91
00301 
00302 \remarks 
00303 
00304       calculates the gradient of the costs
00305 
00306  *******************************************************************************
00307  Function Parameters: [in]=input,[out]=output
00308 
00309  \param[in]     a: vector of parameters
00310  \param[out]    g: gradient vector
00311 
00312  ******************************************************************************/
00313 void 
00314 f_dLda(double *a, double *g)
00315 
00316 {
00317 
00318         int    i;
00319         
00320         for (i=1; i<=N_LINKS; ++i) {
00321                 g[i] = (th[i]-th0[i]);
00322         }
00323 
00324 }
00325 
00326 /*!*****************************************************************************
00327  *******************************************************************************
00328 \note  f_M
00329 \date  10/20/91
00330 
00331 \remarks 
00332 
00333       calculates the constraints; a proper fulfillment of the constraints
00334       results in 0 result of this function for each constraint
00335 
00336  *******************************************************************************
00337  Function Parameters: [in]=input,[out]=output
00338 
00339  \param[in]     a: vector of parameters
00340  \param[out]    c: constraint result vector
00341 
00342  ******************************************************************************/
00343 void 
00344 f_M(double *a, double *c)
00345 
00346 {
00347 
00348         int    i;
00349         
00350         c[1] = l[1]*cos(a[1])-l[2]*cos(a[1]+a[2])+l[3]*cos(a[1]+a[2]+a[3])-x0;
00351         c[2] = l[1]*sin(a[1])+l[2]*sin(a[1]+a[2])+l[3]*sin(a[1]+a[2]+a[3])-y0;
00352 }
00353 
00354 /*!*****************************************************************************
00355  *******************************************************************************
00356 \note  f_dMda
00357 \date  10/20/91
00358 
00359 \remarks 
00360 
00361       calculates the Jacobian of the constraints
00362 
00363  *******************************************************************************
00364  Function Parameters: [in]=input,[out]=output
00365 
00366  \param[in]     a: vector of parameters
00367  \param[out]    j: constraint jacobian matrix
00368 
00369  ******************************************************************************/
00370 void 
00371 f_dMda(double *a, double **j)
00372 
00373 {
00374 
00375                 
00376         j[1][1] = -1.*Sin(a[1]) + 1.*Sin(a[1] + a[2]) - 1.*Sin(a[1] + a[2] + a[3]);
00377         j[1][2] = 1.*Sin(a[1] + a[2]) - 1.*Sin(a[1] + a[2] + a[3]);
00378         j[1][3] = -1.*Sin(a[1] + a[2] + a[3]);
00379         j[2][1] = 1.*Cos(a[1]) + 1.*Cos(a[1] + a[2]) + 1.*Cos(a[1] + a[2] + a[3]);
00380         j[2][2] = 1.*Cos(a[1] + a[2]) + 1.*Cos(a[1] + a[2] + a[3]);
00381         j[2][3] = 1.*Cos(a[1] + a[2] + a[3]);;
00382         
00383 }
